climbs.name: To Honor and Obey
climbs.fa: TR (led 7-18-08 by Brian Cabe and followed by Eric Hobday)

content.description: Climb up, clip first bolt on Groom with a View.  Clip second bolt with a double length sling, then step down and traverse back to the right.  Ascend past a thin horizontal seam, to another, and climb up to the flaring crack, which gets not-as-flaring the higher you go.  Finish at To Have and To Hold anchor.
content.protection: The lower middle of the route has very poor pro.  Possible to place a shallow angle piton in the very shallow crack, and, tie it off in combo with a very dubious micro stopper.  Above that, another thin horizontal crack takes a thin knifeblade with 4 really poor small stoppers which might protect the climb up to the flaring crack.  .5 cam through 3 camalot protects the rest of the climb.  Caution:  initial cam placement low in the crack might not hold as the crack is very flaired down low.  In combo with the poor pin/nuts, this is a serious possibly X rated lead.  Be careful.
content.location: Just left of To Have and To Hold.  Rappel that route.

content.description: Superb, continuously interesting climbing.  Starts with a layback flake and veers up and left through varied challenging moves to the anchors.
content.protection: Bolts with rap anchors at the top.
content.location: Southeast side of Poultry Pillar (across from the Crack House on Castle Rock).  It's the first route to the left of the heavily featured/fragile rock No Climb Zone.  Look for the obvious layback flake.

content.description:
A fun and varied route that starts on a rounded steep

slab.  Has several harder moves on it that could be considered a crux.
content.protection: Bolts with rap anchors at the top.
content.location: Southeast side of Poultry Pillar (across from the Crack House on Castle Rock).  Opunitia is on the far right corner of this wall, right on the edge of the highly featured/fragile rock, No Climb Zone.

content.description: This short route starts with an awkward mantle-type move to a ledge (crux) and then veers up and left through a bulge and onto a finishing ramp. The crux may be height dependent and harder than 10b for shorter climbers.
content.location: Left side of the southeast side of Poultry Pillar (across from the Crack House on Castle Rock)
